intro: Eschscholzia lemmonii, commonly known as Lemmon's poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking orange to red petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and dry habitats, such as chaparral and woodland areas. It produces a capsule fruit that contains numerous small, dark seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
